intro: Jaltomata atiquipa, commonly known as the Atiquipa morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, and it produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Jaltomata atiquipa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the cooler, temperate climate of its native habitat.
